The Shrine of Hope: Chapter 3
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Library: Fan Fiction, Poetry, Birthday List, Links & Non-Fiction Archive: Epics In Progress Section II: The Shrine of Hope: Chapter 3
By Brick on Thursday, October 30, 2003 - 07:40 pm:

We finally caught up with Kesha, who was hurriedly telling the other ranchers to evacuate. Soon we had a very large group of monsters and people, all running down a rather steep mountain. Comical, except for the fact that everybody was running for their lives. Much to our surprise, there were four separate sleds, each pulled by a massive baku, waiting for us at the bottom. We didn't ask questions, only hopped on the sleds.

After we had safely got out of Brillia, we had ended up at the central shrine. It was then I decided to ask Kesha just what was going on.

"A huge crack appeared at the top of the mountain, and out climbed a huge furry dragon. I don't know what it really looked like, other than that. We were too scared." Her suzurin had clamped onto her leg and didn't seem to want to come off. "Say, where did little Picott get to?"

"What? He's gone? AGAIN?" I shifted around the crowds, who were busily panicing to each other, and found Picott, fighting with the same squrrel he had a few days ago. This time I decided to pick him up and take him away from the squrrel, not wanting to repeat the experience over. Suddenly, the shrine keeper stepped up to a podium and began to announce.

"People of Brillia! You may not go back to Brillia until further notice, for your own sagety! Meanwhile, any other region is availible to you for living and training!" After this message, many people were moaning and grumbling and complaining, but I didn't mind, I didn't have anything up there anyway. A bit of food, and Picott had his beloved pillow, so we decided to just leave right there and travel to the only place I really remembered besides Brillia: Kalaragi.

**********
